channel.title: Soul Donkey Music
channel.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
channel.description: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey presents a deep soulful stereophonic listening experience for the discerning audiophile searching for enlightenment through the unification of melody, harmony, rhythm, and timbre in a househead-friendly format.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey invites all discerning audiophiles to a unique stereophonic listening experience presented through an eclectic blend of jazz-influenced ass-shaking deep house music that will free your mind, touch your soul, and bring
channel.itunes:summary: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey invites all discerning audiophiles to a unique stereophonic listening experience presented through an eclectic blend of jazz-influenced ass-shaking deep house music that will free your mind, touch your soul, and bring joy to your world.

itunes:owner.itunes:name: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey

channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: "If we can dance together, we can live together." -- Michael Brody

item.title: Volume 8, Number 1
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: Happy New Year! May this music help guide you to your Happy Place as we start this next rounding of the Sun. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com
item.itunes:subtitle: "Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Louis Pasteur, Michelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson and Albert Einstein." -- H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
item.itunes:summary:
Happy New Year!
May this music help guide you to your Happy Place as we start this next rounding of the Sun.
Love and happiness,
Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage, soulful house, dance
item.author: rodney@souldonkeymusic.com (Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey)

item.title: Volume 7, Number 4
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: This very, very, very overdue episode of Soul Donkey Music is dedicated to Mr. and Mrs. David and Maeve Spatt who celebrated their first 400 days of wedded matrimonial bliss at the time of this recording. Please enjoy this incarnation of a Soul Donkey Wedding Reception with our warmest regards. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com
item.itunes:subtitle: "Fear less, hope more, eat less, chew more, whine less, breathe more, talk less, say more, love more, and all good things will be yours." -- Swedish Proverb
item.itunes:summary:
This very, very, very overdue episode of Soul Donkey Music is dedicated to Mr. and Mrs. David and Maeve Spatt who celebrated their first 400 days of wedded matrimonial bliss at the time of this recording. Please enjoy this incarnation of a Soul Donkey Wedding Reception with our warmest regards.
Love and happiness,
Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage, soulful house, dance
item.author: rodney@souldonkeymusic.com (Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey)

item.title: Volume 7, Number 3
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: This episode is dedicated to the memory of Kris Kono who passed away recently after 46 years of bringing joy to this world. http://www.boston.com/bostonglobe/obituaries/articles/2011/05/16/kris_kono_at_46_brought_warmth_energy_to_many_as_dj_therapist Please enjoy this uninterrupted presentation of her classic "Ochun Sessions." Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "I sweat real sweat and I shake real shakes." -- Elizabeth Taylor
item.itunes:summary:
This episode is dedicated to the memory of Kris Kono who passed away recently after 46 years of bringing joy to this world.
http://www.boston.com/bostonglobe/obituaries/articles/2011/05/16/kris_kono_at_46_brought_warmth_energy_to_many_as_dj_therapist
Please enjoy this uninterrupted presentation of her classic "Ochun Sessions."
Love and happiness,
Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey

item.title: Volume 7, Number 2
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: Happy Spring! We have been offline a little longer than expected (life happens when you're busy making other plans) but we're back now, and we'd like to thank you all for your continued support. Please enjoy the music. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: “Take nothing for granted: a true life is earned second by second, thought by thought.” -- Bill Purdin
item.itunes:summary:
Happy Spring! We have been offline a little longer than expected (life happens when you're busy making other plans) but we're back now, and we'd like to thank you all for your continued support.
Please enjoy the music.
Love and happiness,
Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage, soulful house, dance

item.title: Volume 6, Number 10
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: this mix is a gift from old friend michael alexis a.k.a. "cool_dj big ones" for helping him move his *massive* vinyl collection from boston to brooklyn on father's day earlier this summer. entitled "grainy days (volume 2)," we hope that this deep soulful compilation finds you in good health and helps your mind get ready for what is looking like another stellar new england fall. your continued patronage and support is greatly appreciated and we encourage you to drop us an email or leave us some feedback in the apple store. thanks again to cool_dj big ones for a great set and we wish him nothing but continued success and good fortune. love and happiness, rodney marable a.k.a. the soul donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: “Instead of thinking about what you're missing, try thinking about what you have that everyone else is missing.” -- Herm Albright
item.itunes:summary:
this mix is a gift from old friend michael alexis a.k.a. "cool_dj big ones" for helping him move his *massive* vinyl collection from boston to brooklyn on father's day earlier this summer. entitled "grainy days (volume 2)," we hope that this deep soulful compilation finds you in good health and helps your mind get ready for what is looking like another stellar new england fall. your continued patronage and support is greatly appreciated and we encourage you to drop us an email or leave us some feedback in the apple store. thanks again to cool_dj big ones for a great set and we wish him nothing but continued success and good fortune.
love and happiness,
rodney marable a.k.a. the soul donkey
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage, soulful house

item.title: Volume 6, Number 9
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: enjoy this gem from the soul donkey's mix cd archive by old friend kyle moffitt a.k.a. big kuntry -- this selection is called "me spin pretty one day" and was originally recorded in 2004. we hope this music helps you break into your fall groove on a positive note. love and happiness, rodney marable a.k.a. the soul donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com
item.itunes:subtitle: "There were no weapons of mass destruction and Saddam Hussein was not involved in the September 11th attack." -- Charles Rangel
item.itunes:summary:
enjoy this gem from the soul donkey's mix cd archive by old friend kyle moffitt a.k.a. big kuntry -- this selection is called "me spin pretty one day" and was originally recorded in 2004. we hope this music helps you break into your fall groove on a positive note.
love and happiness,
rodney marable a.k.a. the soul donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com

item.title: Volume 6, Number 8
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: the soul donkey trusts that you had an excellent summer and that this music finds you and your family in good health and spirit. we hope that you can still recognize and appreciate the lost art of mood creation and groove sustainment using dynamics, an ancient art rarely practiced by today's so-called modern dj. love and happiness, rodney marable a.k.a. the soul donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com
item.itunes:subtitle: "It's not the load that breaks you down, it's the way you carry it." -- Lena Horne
item.itunes:summary:
the soul donkey trusts that you had an excellent summer and that this music finds you and your family in good health and spirit. we hope that you can still recognize and appreciate the lost art of mood creation and groove sustainment using dynamics, an ancient art rarely practiced by today's so-called modern dj.
love and happiness,
rodney marable a.k.a. the soul donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage
item.author: rodney@souldonkeymusic.com (Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey)

item.title: Volume 6, Number 7
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: max metral a.k.a. dj holiday gave me this cd in the parking lot of milton academy after a bssc soccer match in the summer of 2001 when we were playing together for druid celtic. i distinctly remember nearly losing control of my car on 95-s at the beginning of the second movement (you will see what i mean soon enough). max has promised to provide us with a playlist at some point in the future but i think we will focus more on getting him into the studio for a live session. we hope you enjoy this gem of a mix and that you can find some time to leave us some positive feedback in the itunes store. brenna casey marable returns as our guest photographer. may this music aid your struggle. love and happiness, rodney marable a.k.a. the soul donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "If the milk industry can make their product seem sexy and increase consumer demand, there must be hope for music." -- Gary Arnold
item.itunes:summary:
max metral a.k.a. dj holiday gave me this cd in the parking lot of milton academy after a bssc soccer match in the summer of 2001 when we were playing together for druid celtic. i distinctly remember nearly losing control of my car on 95-s at the beginning of the second movement (you will see what i mean soon enough). max has promised to provide us with a playlist at some point in the future but i think we will focus more on getting him into the studio for a live session. we hope you enjoy this gem of a mix and that you can find some time to leave us some positive feedback in the itunes store.
brenna casey marable returns as our guest photographer.
may this music aid your struggle.
love and happiness,
rodney marable a.k.a. the soul donkey
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage
item.author: rodney@souldonkeymusic.com (Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey)

item.title: Volume 6, Number 6
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: Our guest musician this week is old friend Kris Kono. Our guest photographer is Gracie Casey of Pottsville, PA. We hope that this music finds you and your family in good health and spirits and that this podcast continues to help you survive the daily grind of life. Please leave us a comment in the iTunes Store if you like what you've been hearing. Your support means everything. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "I'd rather be an ugly baby than a dumb baby." -- Dr. Heather Wilcox
item.itunes:summary:
Our guest musician this week is old friend Kris Kono. Our guest photographer is Gracie Casey of Pottsville, PA.
We hope that this music finds you and your family in good health and spirits and that this podcast continues to help you survive the daily grind of life.
Please leave us a comment in the iTunes Store if you like what you've been hearing. Your support means everything.
Love and happiness,
Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage

item.title: Volume 6, Number 5
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: We hope that this music finds you and your family in good health and spirits and that this podcast continues to help you survive the daily grind of life. Please leave us a comment in the iTunes Store if you like what you've been hearing. Your support means everything. In the meantime, we hope you enjoy the photography which was provided by old friend Keith B of Chicago's KBev Photography. Please visit his web site at http://www.kbevphoto.com to learn more about this up and coming artist. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "Civil government, so far as it is instituted for the security of property, is in reality instituted for the defense of the rich against the poor." -- Adam Smith
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Volume 6, Number 4
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: We hope you find this music finds you and your loved ones in good health and harmony. The photography in this episode was provided by old friend Krob. We are humbled by your continued love and support. 2010 is going to be one of the great ones. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "Life is a marvelous, transitory adventure." -- Nikki Giovanni
item.itunes:summary:
We hope you find this music finds you and your loved ones in good health and harmony.
The photography in this episode was provided by old friend Krob.
We are humbled by your continued love and support. 2010 is going to be one of the great ones.
Love and happiness,
Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey

item.description: This episode was produced exclusively for Mr. and Mrs. Eric and Heather Torrey. May their love continue to grow. We hope that this house music finds you in positive spirits and good health. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "Unconditional love not only means I am with you, but also I am for you, all the way, right or wrong." -- Duke Ellington

item.title: Volume 6, Number 2
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: We trust that this music finds your life pointed in a positive direction. Our guest photographer is old friend Ales Vlasak who took most of the images that appear in this episode at Burning Man. Thank you again for the continued support. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "The men the American people admire most extravagantly are the most daring liars; the men they detest most violently are those who try to tell them the truth." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Volume 6, Number 1
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: So much has gone down in the world since the last episode of "Soul Donkey Music" that we had to take a step back and focus only on the music or this mix would never have gotten done. We thank you across the world for your continued support of this music and culture. We would also like to send a special "happy birthday" greetings to Househead Pete and DJ Bruno, two stalwarts of the Boston house music scene. As always, be sure to drink plenty of water and stretch properly before dancing. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "Censorship is to art as lynching is to justice." -- Henry Louis Gates
item.itunes:summary:
So much has gone down in the world since the last episode of "Soul Donkey Music" that we had to take a step back and focus only on the music or this mix would never have gotten done.
We thank you across the world for your continued support of this music and culture. We would also like to send a special "happy birthday" greetings to Househead Pete and DJ Bruno, two stalwarts of the Boston house music scene.
As always, be sure to drink plenty of water and stretch properly before dancing.
Love and happiness,
Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage
item.author: rodney@souldonkeymusic.com (Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey)

item.title: Volume 5, Number 4
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: We apologize for the recent dearth of episodes. We will make it up to you this spring. In the meantime, please enjoy the mix! This episode's photography was taken by Eric Torrey and Heather Topley in Montreal. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com
item.itunes:subtitle: "If you cannot find peace within yourself, you will never find it anywhere else." -- Marvin Gaye
item.itunes:summary:
We apologize for the recent dearth of episodes. We will make it up to you this spring. In the meantime, please enjoy the mix! This episode's photography was taken by Eric Torrey and Heather Topley in Montreal.

item.title: Volume 5, Number 3
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: We offer this special "no talking" presentation of deep house music to the dancer inside of you. Get out of the house this weekend -- life is just too short to waste it stressing about things you cannot control. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com
item.itunes:subtitle: "What is conservatism? Is it not the adherence to the old and tried against the new and untried?" -- Abraham Lincoln
item.itunes:summary:
We offer this special "no talking" presentation of deep house music to the dancer inside of you. Get out of the house this weekend -- life is just too short to waste it stressing about things you cannot control.
Love and happiness,
Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com

item.title: Volume 5, Number 2
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: This deep and soulful house music selection is a special gift from The Soul Donkey to the outgoing American presidential administration with the hopes that it helps them pack faster. Cynics and haters, feel free to get back on the wagon after the salt has washed out of your system. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "You can't lead the people if you don't love the people. You can't save the people if you don't serve the people." -- Dr. Cornell West
item.itunes:summary:
This deep and soulful house music selection is a special gift from The Soul Donkey to the outgoing American presidential administration with the hopes that it helps them pack faster. Cynics and haters, feel free to get back on the wagon after the salt has washed out of your system.
Love and happiness,
Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage
item.author: rodney@souldonkeymusic.com (Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey)

item.title: Volume 5, Number 1
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: Happy New Year from our house to yours. We hope that you had a wonderful holiday period and that this deep house music helps you appreciate the upcoming inauguration. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "A good compromise, a good piece of legislation, is like a good sentence or a good piece of music. Everybody can recognize it. They say, 'Huh, it works, it makes sense.'" -- Barack Obama
item.itunes:summary:
Happy New Year from our house to yours. We hope that you had a wonderful holiday period and that this deep house music helps you appreciate the upcoming inauguration.
Love and happiness,
Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage
item.author: rodney@souldonkeymusic.com (Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey)

item.title: Volume 4, Number 16
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.description: We hope that you are enjoying a wonderful time with friends and family. DJ Kris Kono makes her first appearance on Soul Donkey Music. On Christmas Eve, please remember that we need to spend more time looking out for each other and less energy with the crab-in-the-bucket attitude. Thank you for the love and support over the years. May this deep house music keep you safe throughout your travels. All photography for this episode came from Kris' web site at http://www.kriskono.com -- please visit site to find out more about her gigs across New England. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "If we can dance together, we can live together." -- DJ Bruno
item.itunes:summary:
We hope that you are enjoying a wonderful time with friends and family. DJ Kris Kono makes her first appearance on Soul Donkey Music. On Christmas Eve, please remember that we need to spend more time looking out for each other and less energy with the crab-in-the-bucket attitude.
Thank you for the love and support over the years. May this deep house music keep you safe throughout your travels.
All photography for this episode came from Kris' web site at http://www.kriskono.com -- please visit site to find out more about her gigs across New England.
Love and happiness,
Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage
item.author: rodney@souldonkeymusic.com (Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey)

item.title: Volume 4, Number 15
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.description: Happy holidays from our house to yours!
item.itunes:subtitle: "Soul is a way of life, but it is always the hard way." -- Ray Charles
item.itunes:summary: Happy holidays from our house to yours!
item.itunes:keywords: house music, deep house, garage
item.author: rodney@souldonkeymusic.com (Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey)

item.title: Volume 4, Number 14
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.description: We are perched on the vanguard of an underground musical renaissance not seen since the disco era. People, get ready! Our guest photographer this week is my boy Keith B from Chicago who captured these images in Grant Park on Election Night during President-elect Obama's victory speech. You can find out more about this talented brother by visiting his web site at http://www.kbevphoto.com.
item.itunes:subtitle: "Never give a sword to a man who can't dance." -- Confucius
item.itunes:summary: We are perched on the vanguard of an underground musical renaissance not seen since the disco era. People, get ready! Our guest photographer this week is my boy Keith B from Chicago who captured these images in Grant Park on Election Night during President-elect Obama's victory speech. item.title: Volume 4, Number 13
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.description: The Fifteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution Section 1. The right of citizens of the United States to vote shall not be denied or abridged by the United States or by any State on account of race, color, or previous condition of servitude. Section 2. The Congress shall have power to enforce this article by appropriate legislation.
item.itunes:subtitle: "You can't base your life on other people's expectations." -- Stevie Wonder
item.itunes:summary:
The Fifteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution
Section 1. The right of citizens of the United States to vote shall not be denied or abridged by the United States or by any State on account of race, color, or previous condition of servitude.
Section 2. The Congress shall have power to enforce this article by appropriate legislation.
item.itunes:keywords: deep, soulful, underground, house, dance, club, garage, music, house music, soulful house

item.title: Volume 4, Number 10
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.itunes:subtitle: "It's the repetition of affirmations that leads to belief. And once that belief becomes a deep conviction, things begin to happen.” -- Muhammad Ali

item.title: Volume 4, Number 9

item.title: Volume 4, Number 8
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.description: This special no-talking episode is dedicated to Chase Reginald Marable who made his first tackle on March 11, 2008. The Soul Donkey would also like to send an extra special pre-greeting to the Fischel twins, congratulations to Ben Haner and Sandra Coelho on their upcoming nuptials, and good luck to Jazmine-san (Santa Clara) on finals. You could have heard this in your nightclub. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "I want to be more African." -- Paul Robeson

item.title: Volume 4, Number 7
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.description: Spring is in the air and WMC is almost upon us. To warm you up, DJ KC Hallett makes his first appearance on the podcast as he presents "t.a.m.i.t.m." (pronounced tah-mitt-em) to help you get warmed up for WMC this year. We are pretty confident that you're going to end up playing this one all springtime long. If you are in the Boston area, you can catch KC on Friday evenings at the Middlesex Lounge (Central Square, Cambridge) and then follow him to Redline in Harvard Square. He is also a resident of the infamous Soul Revival parties and appears regularly at various other Boston nightspots. You should visit his Myspace page (http://www.myspace.com/kcsgroove) for more detailed information on where he is and what he is doing). Our guest photographer this week is old friend Amy Giese, who has left Boston for the Parson School for Design in New York City. Please visit her website learn more about her artwork (http://webspace.newschool.edu/~giesa416/). Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com/podcast.html
item.itunes:subtitle: "The greatest gift is not being afraid to question." -- Ruby Dee

item.title: Volume 4, Number 6
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.description: The Soul Donkey has rejoined old friend KC Hallett for "The Friday Alternative" at Redline in Harvard Square (Cambridge, MA) from 10pm-2am. Come through if you're ever in town. We hope you are enjoying the less-talkative format and that you recognize how much your support and patronage are appreciated. We will be conducting a major overhaul of the web site so the playlists may not be in their usual location until April. Don't panic! You can drop us an email if you're curious about anything that we have played in the meantime. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey http://www.souldonkeymusic.com/podcast.html
item.itunes:subtitle: "You really can change the world if you care enough." -- Marian Wright Edelman
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Volume 4, Number 5
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.description: The Soul Donkey made this music for that part of the evening when it's too late to go out but too early to sleep. This happens more often than you think. You may also find this very soothing while taking the bus, train, or ferry. We are keeping the talking to a minimum and letting the music speak for us. Portions of this episode were taken from "Embellish" by Vonnie Holiday of eu4ic Sounz. We close with an edit by KC Hallett. Go in peace. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "Breathe. Let go. And remind yourself that this very moment is the only one you know you have for sure. " -- Oprah Winfrey
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Volume 4, Number 4
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.description: More deep soulful house music with minimal intrusion -- you can't get it better anywhere else. You can find the playlist by visiting the usual location: http://www.souldonkeymusic.com/podcast.html. This week's photography was provided by Gracie Casey. Remember you saw her work here first. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "There is no shortcut to utopia." -- Claude McKay

item.title: Volume 4, Number 3
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.description: The Soul Donkey reminds you to vote in the upcoming elections if you are eligible. If you're not, get cracking because November will be here faster than you think. This episode features music from Rodney Marable, Franck Roger, KC Hallett, a:xus, DJ Sneak, King Britt, and others. We hope that this musical presentation will prod you into doing some research on your candidate's merits rather than blindly accepting what is placed in front of you. Not everyone in the world has this right. Use it. As always, you can find the playlist by visiting: http://www.souldonkeymusic.com/podcast.html Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names." -- JFK

item.title: Volume 4, Number 2
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.description: This mix is entitled "Resolutions" and was originally released in Vancouver on January 8, 2008. Featuring music and spoken word from MLK, Byron Stigley, Jeremias Santiago, Jeff Sharel, DJ Rasoul, Women of Color, Afro-Mystik, and Rodney Marable, the playlist for this set can be viewed by visiting: http://www.thefreshpage.com/rodneymarable/music/resolutions Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "He who teaches his race to hate another does not love his own." -- Carter G. Woodson

item.title: Volume 4, Number 1
item.itunes:author: Rodney Marable
item.description: The Soul Donkey trusts that you had a wonderful holiday filled with good times and fun with family. We have been very busy outfitting the studio with new audio and computer equipment that will make it easier for us to churn out these high-quality deep house podcasts that you crave and desire -- we hope that the next few weeks prove to be worth your valuable time. As always, you can find the playlist by visiting http://www.souldonkeymusic.com/podcast.html and following the appropriate link for the episode in question. Love and happiness, Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
item.itunes:subtitle: "I love myself when I am laughing." -- Zola Neale Hurston

channel.media:credit: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey
channel.media:description: Rodney Marable a.k.a. The Soul Donkey invites all discerning audiophiles to a unique stereophonic listening experience presented through an eclectic blend of jazz-influenced ass-shaking deep house music that will free your mind, touch your soul, and bring
